metadata.title: CVE-2024-21096 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Client: mysqldump). Supported versions that are affected are 8.0.36 andprior and 8.3.0 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allowsunauthenticated attacker with logon to the infrastructure where MySQLServer executes to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of thisvulnerability can result in unauthorized update, insert or delete access tosome of MySQL Server accessible data as well as unauthorized read access toa subset of MySQL Server accessible data and unauthorized ability to causea partial denial of service (partial DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.1 BaseScore 4.9 (Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability impacts). CVSSVector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-21096` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.37-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
mysql-client - 8.0.37-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.37-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.37-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
mysql-router - 8.0.37-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
mysql-server - 8.0.37-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.37-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.37-0ubuntu0.22.04.3

mysql-testsuite - 8.0.37-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.37-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.37-0ubuntu0.22.04.3').
mariadb-10.6 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:10.6.18-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
